name: Garlic And Herb Shirmp
instructions: Place salt, lemon zest, juice, and 3 cloves garlic in bowl of a mortar and pestle. Pound with the pestle until mixture begins to form a paste, about 2 minutes.
Add chopped basil, parsley, pepper flakes, oregano, and thyme and pound with pestle until mixture begin to come together, about 5 minutes.
Drizzle about 1 tablespoon of the olive oil into herb mixture. Grind together until mixture begins to form a sauce for marinating, about 1 minute.
Place shrimp in a large bowl and mix. Place on a pan and cook for 5 minutes on each side.

name: Greek Grilled Chicken
instructions: Whisk garlic, oregano, red pepper flakes, black pepper, lemon juice, olive oil, and vinegar together in a large bowl.
Make 2 slashes on the skin side down to the bone in the thigh section and 1 in the leg section of each leg quarter.
Season both sides of chicken generously with kosher salt.
Transfer to bowl with marinade and thoroughly coat all sides. Cover and marinate in refrigerator 4 to 12 hours.
Transfer chicken to paper-towel-lined sheet pan to drain slightly.
Place leg quarters on grill skin side down over semi-direct heat. Cook 6 or 7 minutes.
Turn chicken and cook another 6 to 7 minutes. Continue cooking and turning for 8 to 10 more minutes.

name: Green Rice Casserole
ingredientLines: 3 oz green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter a 2 quart casserole or cast iron pan and set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked rice, about three-quarters of the cheddar, ricotta, sour cream, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Mix till well blended.
Add in spinach, bell pepper, and scallions and mix till well blended.
Scrape the mixture into the prepared casserole. Sprinkle the remaining cheddar cheese evenly over the top and bake till golden, about 30 minutes.
Rest for 5 minutes and serve.

name: Grilled Halloumi With Vegetables
instructions: Place sliced halloumi cheese on a grill about 3 minutes on each side.
Place vegetables on a plate, and season with salt and pepper.
On the vegetables place grilled halloumi, and drizzle with olive oil. Serve.

name: Grilled Spatchcooked Greek Chicken
instructions: Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, garlic, rosemary, and tarragon together in a measuring cup.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Place chicken on a rimmed baking sheet. Pour 1/2 of the oil mixture over the chicken and reserve the remaining 1/2.
Using your hands, massage the oil mixture into the chicken skin. Season with salt and pepper.
Grill chicken skin-side up over indirect heat for 50 minutes. Move chicken over direct heat and grill 5 minutes.
Carefully flip chicken over skin-side down and grill until skin is brown and crispy, about 5 more minutes.
Transfer chicken to a serving platter and let rest for 10 minutes. Drizzle reserved oil mixture over the chicken.

name: Goat Cheese Stuffed Celery
ingredientLines: 8 oz celery, rinsed, cut in half
instructions: Combine goat cheese, red bell pepper, garlic, and basil in a blender. Blend until smooth.
Divide the goat cheese mixture between the celery stalks, stuffing the curved indent of the veggie. Serve immediately.

name: Ginger Beef Stir-Fry With Bok Choy
ingredientLines: 4 oz beef steak, trimmed and chopped
1 lb baby bok choy, trimmed and chopped
instructions: Combine the beef, ginger, soy sauce, and arrowroot powder in a medium bowl. Stir well. Add sesame oil and stir until the beef is lightly coated.
Combine oyster-flavored sauce and the sherry in a small bowl. Set aside.
Heat a 14-inch flat-bottomed carbon-steel wok over high heat. Swirl in olive oil. Add beef and cook for 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Add bok choy and broth to the pan. Cover and cook until the bok choy greens are bright green and almost all the liquid has been absorbed, about 1 minute.
Return the beef to the pan, add the reserved sauce, and stir-fry until the beef is just cooked through and the bok choy is tender-crisp, about 1 minute. Serve immediately.

name: Garlic Chili Prawns In Tomato Sauce
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Add the olive oil to the pan over a medium heat and fry the spring onions for 2 minutes. Add the garlic and fry for a further 30 seconds.
Add the fresh tomatoes to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir the arrowroot into the prawns and add them to the pan. Stir into the tomatoes.
Season with salt and pepper and stir in the tomato puree and tobasco sauce. Add the coriander and most of the parsley.
Simmer the sauce for 6 minutes and serve hot.

name: Gnocchi With Spinach And Tomatoes
instructions: Preheat the oven to 390°F.
Add the cherry tomatoes to a roasting tin, drizzle over ½ a tbsp of balsamic vinegar and 1 tbsp of olive oil, add ¼ tsp each of salt and black pepper then roast them for about 15 minutes.
Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil. Add the gnocchi to the water and as soon as they rise to the top, about 3 minutes, remove with a slotted spoon.
In a large frying pan add 2 tbsp of butter, melt the butter over a medium to high heat then once the butter is bubbling add the gnocchi.
Fry the gnocchi for a maximum of 5 minutes, tossing regularly. Once the gnocchi is golden brown remove it from the pan.
Add the minced garlic and cook for a minute then add the spinach.
The spinach will wilt quite quickly so now add the grated cheese, the cherry tomatoes along with any juices in the roasting tin.

name: Glass Noodle Soup
ingredientLines: 9 oz skinless, boneless chicken breasts, sliced
instructions: Soak the bean threads in a large bowl of hot water until soft, about 15 minutes,drain and cut into bite-size lengths. Divide the noodles into 3 bowls.
Bring the chicken broth, garlic, ginger, and lemongrass to a boil in a large saucepan, reduce heat to medium-low and cook the mixture at a simmer until fragrant.
Add the chicken and shrimp to the soup, simmer until the chicken pieces are cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes.
Stir the lime juice and fish sauce through the soup. Ladle the soup over the noodles, top with green onion to serve.

name: Greek Spinach Rice
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add rice and stir until every grain is coated in oil and you hear it start to sizzle.
Stir in some salt, pepper, cayenne, and green onions and cook for about 1 minute. Add dill, spinach, and 2 cups of water. Mix well and bring to a simmer.
Cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Uncover and stir well. Cover again and let sit for 5 minutes.
Divide rice mixture evenly into six bowls. Squeeze some lemon over each serving, then top with feta cheese and chili flakes before serving.

name: Garlic Avocado Spread
instructions: Soak cashews in a bowl of water, 8 hours to overnight.
Combine cashews, avocado, lime juice, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and salt in a blender, blend until smooth.

name: Glazed Salmon With Wilted Spinach
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and lay baking tray with baking paper.
Place orange juice, honey, ginger and garlic in a small pan over medium heat, and bring to the boil.
Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes or until slightly reduced and syrupy.
Place salmon on prepared tray. Reserve half the glaze. Use remaining glaze to brush over salmon fillets. Bake for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large frypan over high heat. Add the baby spinach leaves and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes, until just wilted. Season.
To serve, divide the wilted spinach and salmon fillets among serving plates and garnish with some sprigs of thyme.

name: Greek Peas With Tomato And Dill
ingredientLines: ½ potato, peeled and cut into wedges
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat and cook onions until soft but not browned, about 5 minutes.
Add peas, carrots, tomatoes, potato, dill, salt, and pepper. Add water if there is not enough liquid from the tomatoes.
Stir thoroughly and bring to a boil. Lower heat and cook, partially covered, until peas and potato are soft, about 30 minutes.
Ensure that any remaining water from the tomatoes has evaporated before serving.

name: Grilled Salmon Salad
instructions: Season salmon with salt and pepper and cook on a grill for about 5 minutes on each side. When done, slice the salmon on small chunks.
In a bowl mix all other ingredients and season with olive oil, salt and lemon juice.
Place salad mix and salmon chunks on a platter and serve.

name: Grill Master Chicken Wings
instructions: Prepare wings, Combine chicken wings, soy sauce, and Italian dressing in a large resealable plastic bag.
Coat chicken wings with marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator, 4 hours to overnight.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Prepare sauce, Melt ghee in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in hot pepper sauce and soy sauce until combined. Remove from heat and set aside.
Remove chicken wings from marinade and pat dry, discard any remaining marinade.
Cook on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, until chicken is browned and no longer pink, 25 to 30 minutes.
Place grilled wings in a large bowl. Pour sauce over wings, toss until well-coated.

name: Garlic Butter Steak Bites
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat oil in skillet over high heat. Once hot, add in steak bites and season with salt and pepper. Cook 2 minutes undisturbed. Stir, cook another 2 minutes. Set aside.
Reduce heat to medium and add butter to same pan. Once melted, add garlic and parsley and cook about a minute, stirring.
Remove from heat. Add steak bites back into pan and toss well. Serve immediately.

name: Gazpacho
ingredientLines: 6 oz bread, sliced and crust removed
instructions: Place the bread slices in a bowl with ½ cup of water. Let the bread soak while you work on the tomatoes. Squeeze the bread to ring out any water.
Place the tomatoes in a large pot of boiling water for 40 seconds. With a slotted spoon, remove the tomatoes from the boiling water and let them cool for about a minute and peel the skin off.

Place the tomatoes, cucumbers, celery, bell peppers, green onions and garlic in blender. Top with soaked bread, olive oil and sherry vinegar. Add the salt, pepper, cumin, cayenne pepper and blend all together,
Transfer to a glass container or large canning jars. Cover tightly and chill in refrigerator.
When ready to serve, give the gazpacho a quick stir then transfer to serving bowls. Top with olive oil and a garnish of fresh basil, chopped cucumber and tomatoes.

name: Ground Beef Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a casserole dish.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
Mix salt, garlic salt and tomato sauce into ground beef, simmer until flavors blend, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat, cover skillet, and cool to room temperature.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook egg noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally for about 5 minutes.
Mix sour cream, cream cheese, and onion in a bowl. Scoop half the noodles into the prepared casserole dish, top with half the sour cream mixture.
Spoon half the ground beef mixture atop sour cream layer. Repeat layering with remaining ingredients. Top casserole with Cheddar cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until Cheddar cheese has browned, 25 to 30 minutes.

name: Green Spinach Waffles
instructions: Separate egg whites from egg yolks. Add spinach, butter, yolks, flour, baking powder, nutmeg and salt to the blender and process until you have an smooth batter.
In a medium sized bowl whip egg whites until they reach stiff peaks.
Add the batter and grated cheese and fold everything together with a spatula, trying to incorporate most of the egg whites air into the batter.
Heat a waffle iron and bake waffles. Serve immediately with tomatoes and basil.

name: Garlic Shrimp Linguine
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente, drain. In another pot boil broccoli for 5 to 8 minutes.
In a medium saucepan, melt ghee over medium low heat, add wine, cheese, garlic, parslet, salt and pepper to taste. Simmer over low heat for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
Increase heat to medium high and add shrimp to saucepan, cook for about 3 to 4 minutes or until shrimp begins to turn pink.
Divide pasta into portions, add broccoli and spoon sauce on top, garnish with Parmesan cheese and fresh parsley, if desired.

name: Greek Omelet
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk the eggs with a fork and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Set aside.
Heat a small skillet over medium heat and add the oil. Pour in the egg mixture and cook until almost set, about 5 minutes.
Place the chopped tomato and feta on one half of the omelet and fold the other half over top. Remove from heat and top with parsley.

name: Grilled Asparagus Salad
instructions: Preheat a grill for low heat. Combine the lemon juice and olive oil on a plate. Place asparagus on the plate, and roll around to coat.
Grill asparagus for about 5 minutes, turning at least once, and brushing with the olive oil mixture.
Remove from the grill, and place back onto the plate with the oil.
In a large bowl, combine the spinach, feta cheese, and strawberries
Cut asparagus into bite-size pieces, and add to the salad along with the lemon juice and oil from the plate.
Toss to blend, then serve.

name: Ginger And Turmeric Smoothie
ingredientLines: ¾ tsp finely grated peeled ginger
1 oz unflavored pea protein powder (or other)
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a high-powered blender. Serve immediately.

name: Greek Shrimp With Tomatoes & Feta
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a bowl, mix in 1 tbsp olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper with shrimp. Toss well to cover the shrimp all over.
In a pan, heat olive oil on medium high heat and sauté the onions till soft and starting to turn brown, about 5minutes.
Add in sliced garlic along with red chili flakes and oregano and saute for a minute. Add in wine and cook for 2 minutes.
Add in tomatoes, stir well. Add parsley and simmer for 10 minutes. Add in marinated shrimp and stir well. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Open the lid and sprinkle feta all over. Cover and cook another 5 minutes. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

name: Ham Frittata With Vegetables
instructions: In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Cook bell pepper, onion, and ham for 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, beat eggs, milk, salt, and pepper with a fork or wire whisk until well mixed.
Pour egg mixture over ham mixture. Cook over medium heat 10 minutes, stirring gently, until eggs are almost set. Reduce heat to low.
Top with tomato slices and cheese. Cover and cook 3 minutes.

name: Grilled Chicken Parmesan
ingredientLines: 1 lb chicken breasts, boneless and skinless
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Bring out oven-safe plate and pour two-thirds of the marinara sauce at the bottom of the plate. Set aside.
Preheat a cast-iron grill pan over medium heat and add in the olive oil.
Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper and dried oregano on both sides.
When the pan is ready, sear the chicken on each side for 3 minutes. Remove the chicken onto the marinara sauce in the oven safe plate.
Place pesto on top of each chicken breast and spread it on the entire piece of chicken and then place 2 tbsp of marinara sauce on top of each chicken breast.
Sprinkle the cheese and parsley on top and place the plate in the oven for 15 minutes.

name: Guacamole With Nopales
instructions: Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add nopales and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, about 10 minutes. Let cool.
Mash avocado in a bowl with lime juice, olive oil, and salt. Stir in tomato, jalapeno, cilantro, and cooked nopales.

name: Ham With Red Eye Gravy
instructions: Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir chopped hams until browned, about 5 minutes.
Remove to a plate, reserving the grease in the pan.
Place ham slices in the pan and cook over medium heat until browned, about 5 minutes on each side.
Season both sides with salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Remove ham and reserve on a plate.
Reduce heat to medium-low and sprinkle flour over the pan drippings. Cook and stir for 2 minutes.

name: Greek Style Garlic Chicken Breast
instructions: Cut 3 slits in each chicken breast to allow marinade to penetrate.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, pepper, and paprika for about 30 seconds.
Place chicken in a large bowl, and pour marinade over. Using your hands, work marinade into chicken. Cover, and refrigerate overnight
Preheat grill for medium heat, and lightly oil grate.
Cook chicken on grill until meat is no longer pink and juices run clear.

name: Grilled Tuna
instructions: Place tuna steaks with sour cream and seasoning  in a bowl, coating both sides, marinate in refrigerator for 20 minutes.
Preheat outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.
Grill tuna on the preheated grill until tuna lightens in color but retains a thin line of pink in the center, about 5 minutes on each side.

name: Grilled Chicken And Tomatoes
instructions: Season chicken. In large skillet, cook the chicken on a grill, 5 minutes per side.
Transfer to platter. Repeat with remaining chicken and oil. Add wine, tomatoes to skillet.
Simmer until tomatoes burst and sauce thickens slightly, 5 minutes. Off heat, swirl in butter. Season sauce and spoon over chicken.

name: Greek White Bean Soup
instructions: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a soup pot over medium high heat. Saute onion, celery, carrot, garlic and salt for 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add tomato paste and stir for one minute. Add crushed tomatoes, beans, broth, rosemary, chili flakes and bay leaves. Stir well.
Bring to low boil then simmer on low to medium heat for 30 minutes, until carrots are soft.
Remove one cup of beans to a bowl and mash with a spoon. Stir back into pot. Add remaining oil and whisk into the soup. Serve immediately.

name: Greek Salmon
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Pat dry salmon fillets and place skin-side down on a lined quarter sheet baking pan.
In a small mixing bowl, stir to combine olive oil, lemon juice, dill, garlic, salt, and pepper. Brush or pour the marinade over the salmon and let it sit.
Bake for 15 minutes. Let rest for 5 minutes, then serve.

name: Grilled Tilapia With Veggies
instructions: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat 375°F.
Rub tilapia fillets with olive oil and sprinkle with salt, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder and grill for 5 minutes on each side.
Serve with tomatoes, bell peppers, seasoned with salt, pepper, olive oil and vinegar.

name: Gnocchi Alla Sorrentina
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Cook potatoes in a large pot of boiling water for 20 minutes or until soft. Drain and cool.
Push the potatoes through a potato ricer into a large bowl or onto a floured bench top. Sprinkle over the salt.
Thoroughly combine the flour and potatoes, scrunching it together with your hands and forming into a dough.
Turn the dough onto a floured bench and roll into a large log shape. Divide into 8 pieces.
Roll each piece into a long rope. Then cut into small pieces. Place pieces onto a tray lined with a fresh towel until you are ready to cook them.
Heat oil in a medium pan and add the garlic. Lower the heat and cook garlic for approximately 1 minute.
Pour in the passata and salt. Cover and simmer for approximately 10 minutes.
In a medium pot over medium to high heat, pour in the soy milk and immediately whisk in the corn starch until dissolved.
Add the remaining ingredients and stir briskly to combine. Stir frequently until the sauce becomes thick.
In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook the gnocchi in batches. When the gnocchi float to the surface, carefully remove and drain.
Transfer gnocchi to the tomato sugo and stir to coat. Pour the gnocchi into a large baking or casserole dish. Dollop the mozzarella sauce on top.
Bake for 10 minutes and serve.

name: Garlic-Dijon Mashed Cauliflower
instructions: Cut the cauliflower into roughly equal chunks. Steam for 8 minutes.
While it’s steaming, chop the garlic and put half the oil in a frying pan along with the garlic and fry for 3 mintues. Then turn the heat off but let the pan sit there.
When the cauliflower is ready put it into a bowl and add the garlic and oil infusion, the rest of the oil, nutritional yeast, nutmeg, mustard and salt.
Give it a quick blend with a hand blender, then serve immediately.

name: Green Soup
instructions: Warm the oil in a large sauce pan and lightly fry the onion and garlic, for around 5 minutes.
Add the broccoli, including stalks and leaves, and cover with boiling water. Bring to the boil and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the peas and spinach, ceason with salt and pepper, and simmer for a further 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat and blend until smooth. Top with sour cream and serve.

name: Grilled Chicken Zucchini Salad
instructions: In a mixing bowl mix together lettuce, arugula, and cherry tomatoes. Season with oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Place zucchini slices and chicken breasts on a grill and grill for 3 minutes on each side. Slice chicken breasts.
Place salad mixture on serving plate, top with slices of zucchini and chicken, and serve.

name: Greek Stewed Green Beans
ingredientLines: ¾ lb fresh green beans, trimmed
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and stir in onion. Cook until onion has softened, about 5 minutes.
Add green beans and stir to coat in the oil. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Add pureed tomato, potatoes, salt, and pepper.
Stir well, then add water until beans are barely covered. Bring to a simmer, partially cover with a lid, and cook gently over medium-low heat for 20 minutes.
Uncover towards the end of cooking to reduce sauce if it is too watery. Serve imemdiately.

name: Gnocchi With Tomato Sauce
instructions: Begin by boiling the gnocchi according to package instructions. Strain the gnocchi and add it to a cast iron skillet.
Add the canned tomatoes, red pepper, milk, nutritional yeast, chili flakes, and garlic powder to a blender. Blend until smooth.
Then, add the sauce to the same skillet with the gnocchi.
Turn on the heat and cook the gnocchi and sauce in the skillet for about 5 minutes to thicken and heat the sauce.
Serve garnished with chopped parsley.

name: Hearty Red Lentil Stew
instructions: In a medium sauce pan, cook the onion in oil over medium heat, until softened and golden, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger, curry, cumin, turmeric, chili, and salt. Cook for 1 minute, and then reduce the heat to medium-low.
At this point, add red lentils, tomatoes, and coconut milk. Cook, stirring often, for 25 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Garlic-Bacon Green Beans
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly browned but only slightly crisp.
Drain grease, leaving a small amount in the skillet for later use. Crumble bacon, reserving some for garnish, and set aside.
Cook frozen beans in a covered, microwavable dish for about 3 minutes until thawed, but not fully cooked. Drain liquid, pat dry, and set aside.
Reheat skillet with residual bacon grease over medium-high heat. Stir in bacon and garlic until garlic is lightly golden.
Add green beans and season with onion powder and black pepper. Cook and stir for 1 minute.
Transfer to a serving dish, and garnish with remaining crumbled bacon. Serve hot.

name: Healthier Hot Legs
instructions: In a medium bowl, stir together the chili garlic sauce and hot sauce. Set aside.
Melt ghee in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the drumsticks, and cook until browned on the outside, turning as needed.
Reduce heat to medium-low, and spoon sauce over the chicken to coat.
Simmer, stirring occasionally, until chicken has cooked through and sauce is thick and sticky, about 20 minutes.

name: Greek Tomato Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat and cook onion and garlic until soft and translucent, about 3 minutes. Add rice and cook 2 minutes.
Add broth, tomato sauce, salt, and pepper and bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low.
Cook until all the liquid is absorbed and rice is done, about 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Gnocchi With Chorizo And Peas
instructions: Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large frying pan. Add the prosciutto slices and fry until crisp, turning occasionally.
Drain on kitchen paper, then break into shards.
Add the gnocchi to the pan and fry for 8 minutes until lightly golden on both sides. Add chorizo and cook for a minute more.
Add the peas, a little salt and pepper, and a splash of water to the pan and warm through.
Add the pesto and another splash of water, if needed, and stir to coat well.

name: Grilled Cilantro Salmon
instructions: In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, stir together cilantro, garlic, molasses, and lime juice.
Heat until the molasses is easily stirred, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and let cool slightly.
Place salmon steaks in a baking dish, and season with salt and pepper.
Pour marinade over salmon, cover, and refrigerate 10 minutes.
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat.
Lightly oil grill grate. Place salmon steaks on grill, cook 5 minutes on each side, or until fish is easily flaked with a fork.

name: Ham Fritters
instructions: Sift flour and baking powder into a bowl. Add sliced spring onions, chopped parsley, corn and ham. Season with salt and pepper and stir to combine.
Make a well in the centre, add eggs and milk, then stir to form a batter.
Heat a frying pan, add a film of oil and drop heaped tablespoonfuls of the batter into the pan. Cook for 3 minutes on each side.

name: Ham And Pesto Crostini
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place the bread on the trays. Spray with a little olive oil. Bake, turning once, for 10 minutes
Meanwhile, prepare pesto cream cheese. In a bowl, stir cream cheese with a fork to soften it up. Add pesto and mix well to incorporate.
Spread the pesto on the bread, top with mozzarella and ham. Serve.

name: Grilled Rye Sandwiches
instructions: Spread butter on one side of each bread slice then spread pesto on other side of bread slice.
Place spinach, avocado slices, and cheese on bread and sandwich put together.
Heat skillet on medium high and cook sandwich on each side for approx. 3 minutes until golden brown.
